title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 33.9 - Delivery and storage of alcoholic beverages
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 33.9 - Delivery and storage of alcoholic beverages

State Regulations
(a) The alcoholic beverages sold by a
licensee to a permittee, or sold to a licensee by a permittee must be delivered
simultaneously with the sale, and a separate permit must be obtained for each
delivery of alcoholic beverages to a permittee. (b) Such alcoholic beverages may not be
stored by a licensee for a permittee, in excess of 48 hours, except by express
permission first obtained by the permittee from the Liquor Authority in
writing. (c) All alcoholic
beverages sold to a steamship company or aircraft company must be delivered
directly to the vessel or aircraft. (d) All alcoholic beverages sold to a
purchasing agent representing a principal outside the state must be delivered
to the steamship vessel, railroad car or transportation company for shipment to
the principal outside the state, except by express permission first obtained by
the permittee from the Liquor Authority in writing. (e) Shipments of alcoholic beverages to other
states or countries may be made only pursuant to the laws of such state or
country. (f) An application by a
summer licensee for a permit to store alcoholic beverages on the premises
between the expiration of the license period and the issuance of a new license
for such premises for the following license period shall be accompanied by an
inventory of the alcoholic beverage to be stored, setting forth quantity, type, size of containers and brand names. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
33.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
